messages.content: I live in Khao San, Bangkok. The temple spires and tuk-tuk chaos.
That sounds wonderful! What do you enjoy most about living there?
Every Saturday I love morning at Chatuchak Weekend Market for vintage finds.
That sounds like a great weekend routine!
My neighbor Niran, a muay thai trainer who takes me to local fights. We've become good friends.
It's nice to have friendly neighbors!
For breakfast I usually have pad thai and Thai iced tea from a street cart on Tanao Road.
Sounds delicious!
I'm relocating to Sultanahmet, Istanbul for a photography project!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be exploring the Grand Bazaar then tea at a rooftop overlooking the Bosphorus.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have simit and Turkish tea from the street cart near the Blue Mosque.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Sultanahmet, Istanbul for a few weeks now. I love the call to prayer echoing over the minarets.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Elif, a ceramicist who teaches me İznik tile painting.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Coyoacán, Mexico City for a teaching position!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be visiting the Coyoacán market for handcrafts and street food.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have chilaquiles verdes and café de olla at a local fonda.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Coyoacán, Mexico City for a few weeks now. I love the colorful colonial houses and Frida Kahlo museum nearby.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Elena, a muralist who shows me hidden street art around the barrio.
What a wonderful connection!
I'm relocating to Gamla Stan, Stockholm for a research fellowship!
That's exciting! What are you looking forward to?
My Saturday routine will be exploring antique shops in the old town then fika at Stortorget.
Sounds amazing!
I hear the breakfast scene is great — I plan to have kanelbulle and bryggkaffe at a tiny café on Prästgatan.
You'll love it there!
I've been in Gamla Stan, Stockholm for a few weeks now. I love the colorful 17th-century buildings and narrow alleys.
How are you settling in?
Great! My neighbor Erik, an architect who shows me hidden medieval passages.
What a wonderful connection!

queries.question: What do I usually have for breakfast based on where I live now?

reference_answer.text: Since you currently live in Gamla Stan, Stockholm, your breakfast is kanelbulle and bryggkaffe at a tiny café on Prästgatan. The answer should NOT mention breakfast from your previous cities (Khao San pad thai and Thai iced tea from a street, Sultanahmet simit and Turkish tea from the street ca, Coyoacán chilaquiles verdes and café de olla).
